title: Worked Solution
text: No, events A and B are not independent. Independence refers to the probability of an event occurring not being affected by the occurrence of another event. In this case, the probability of learning both Spanish and German is not equal to the product of the probabilities of learning Spanish and learning German. If A and B were independent, then P(A AND B) would be equal to P(A) * P(B), which is not the case.
